#### About me

I am an applied environmental economist with exceptional skills in quantitative analysis, applied econometric modeling, and spatial data analysis. My research focuses on the field of Environmental and Development Economics, with a particular interest in illegal and unreported fishing, and the analysis of conservation instruments effectiveness.

In addition to my research, I also teach courses in Econometrics and causal inference methods, Statistical & R Programming, and Environmental and Natural Resource Economics, both at the undergraduate and graduate level, as a graduate teaching assistant at Universidad de los Andes. I have a master's degree in Economics from Uniandes and a bachelor's degree in Economics from Universidad de Cartagena, Colombia. I have been a visiting student at Universidad Complutense de Madrid, Justus-Liebig University of Giessen, Wageningen University and Research, and Technical University of Munich. 

Programming skills: Python, R, Bigquery and Stata.
Languages: Spanish and  English

I will be in the Economics Job Markets in 2024-2025. You can find my CV <a href="https://jorgephd.github.io/jorge-montero.github.io/cv/Cv_JorgeMontero.pdf">here</a>
and my Job Market Paper <a href="https://jorgephd.github.io/jorge-montero.github.io/research/Lockdown_and_Fishing.pdf">here</a>.
